intro: Schmidelia anodonta, commonly known as the smoothleaf schmidelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of North America, particularly in the eastern United States. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Schmidelia anodonta typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
